intro: Codia discolor var. cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-leaf codia, is a variant of the codia plant characterized by its distinctive ash-gray foliage. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The leaves are typically elliptical with a smooth margin and a pale, almost waxy texture. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique leaf coloration and texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
